item.description:
What better way to relax after work than a walk through Chatfield Hollow, a lovely state park with many natural features. We can stay on the pavement, or take one of the many trails out into the woods. There is a small beach area on the largest pond, a stream that passes under a covered bridge, and a water wheel by the farthest pond.

Chatfield Hollow is located on Route 80, just west of the Route 81/80 traffic circle. There are parking lots on the right and left sides of the entrance, and we will meet just past there, at the ranger's booth.
Dogs are welcome, but must be on a leash.

I suggest bringing a bottle of water, a hat (the bugs are out), and even bug spray. The warm weather is supposed to continue through the week, so we should have a great evening!
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the ranger's booth at the entrance to the park.
item.name: Thursday Evening Stroll
